content.raw:
It has not changed **yet**. There is a change from 650 and no minimum memory to 1050 with 4GB of memory:

[#!/osrf/subt/wiki/commits/d01779fa302fbe432caaeea085319032cb4b3920](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/commits/d01779fa302fbe432caaeea085319032cb4b3920)

There is a further change from 1050 to 1050 Ti:

[#!/osrf/subt/wiki/commits/e56010437395d853d3752b322bb0553a0acc76be](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/commits/e56010437395d853d3752b322bb0553a0acc76be)

And now it has been suggested here that the actual requirements currently are not 4GB but 6GB. What I am saying is that this is not a good way to let competitors know that there is a change in system requirements.
content.html:
It has not changed yet. There is a change from 650 and no minimum memory to 1050 with 4GB of memory:

#!/osrf/subt/wiki/commits/d01779fa302fbe432caaeea085319032cb4b3920

There is a further change from 1050 to 1050 Ti:

#!/osrf/subt/wiki/commits/e56010437395d853d3752b322bb0553a0acc76be

And now it has been suggested here that the actual requirements currently are not 4GB but 6GB. What I am saying is that this is not a good way to let competitors know that there is a change in system requirements.
